org.accada.reader.rprm.core.msg
Class OutgoingMessageClient

java.lang.Object
  org.accada.reader.rprm.core.msg.OutgoingMessageClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class OutgoingMessageClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

OutgoingMessageClient is a thread responsible to get a message from the OutgoingMessageBuffer and send it to the client using a corresponding * Connection.
There is one OutgoingMessageClient per client. It waits if there are no messages in the buffer. If there is a message available the thread is woken by the OutgoingMessageBuffer and gets the message. Calling the send() method of the Connection implementation the message is sent to the client.

Author:
Dijana Micijevic, ETH Zurich Switzerland, Winter 2003/04, Andreas Fürer, ETH Zurich Switzerland, Winter 2005/06
